Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 9b5109d46bb4c1953eca1b4a2deb644c0276267e

Hey Arthur, thanks for the contribution. A few quick comments:

- This is failing CI due to the .patch files introduced here. We have a "repotest" in CI that verifies no new patches are added in a commit. We're slowly working on getting rid of the existing ones.
- OpenBMC has a fork of linux and u-boot that we carry under our github organization. As long as you are actively working on upstreaming your changes, we should be able to carry them within OpenBMC vs. you creating patches or your own Linux fork. Joel has final say on that.
- In general for reviews, smaller is always better. Be great to see this broken into multiple commits (basic config, u-boot, fans, hwmon, inventory, leds, ...). Same overall content but much easier to review.
We also shouldn't have this custom 'pwrseqd'.  See https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blame/master/meta-layer-guidelines.md#L75
As Patrick said, please submit the kernel changes to the openbmc tree in order to support your system.
please prepend "meta-ibm:" to this commit message as well.
nit: this more belongs in the next patch now (along with the u-boot stuff below). This should be more of a high level intro of the new system.
Thanks for breaking this up into a set of more manageable patches!

The default is already 32mb (https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/blob/d2d23601382942f8bc91fd313b438847d674952b/meta-phosphor/classes/image_types_phosphor.bbclass#L34) so theoretically this is not needed but it can be left as a quick reference on the size of flash for this system.

This file seems pretty non-standard from all the other systems in OpenBMC. In general, I'd expect to see something like meta-ibm/recipes-phosphor/packagegroups/packagegroup-obmc-apps.bbappend and have any specific genesis3 items added in there.

Not sure if I understand it right but do you mean that these should be in separate file like:
meta-ibm/meta-genesis3/recipes-phosphor/packagegroups/packagegroup-obmc-apps.bbappend ?
nit: this file has a mix of spaces and tabs, please convert all tabs to spaces
We're deprecated this and only keep the last 2, so please remove "kirkstone"
I assume using the evb device tree is expected here? No real upstream device tree to utilize here?
genesis3 Devicetree upstream is wip. Hence using the evb kernel for now.
You marked this resolved but didn't do anything.

I apologize for the confusion caused. To clarify, I have decided not to use it in this particular case.
Thanks!

Since this is a machine under meta-ibm, I would expect the common content from meta-ibm to be applied to it.  Even if you're not currently using it, I think it makes sense.  For example, they might have a bbappend for the web-ui that adds/enables their logos and colors.  You'd want this applied to all IBM machines, but you only get it if you include the base meta-ibm as a layer.

I don't work for IBM and I don't maintain this meta-layer, so I guess someone from there can weigh in.
I did check the same for other boards under meta-ibm. Its not being used.
I assume I answered your questions and hence marking it as resolved.
These are no longer needed or desired.
I believe this was copied from an older reference.
So... are you going to delete this?
I wasn't sure if it needed to be removed or kept, so I left it as is. However, I understand your recommendation to remove it and I will push another patch to address this. Thanks

Something is configured wrong if you ended up with this to begin with.  `croserver` should only come into play due to meta-openpower.  Since this isn't a Power machine there should be no reference to `croserver` in any variable.
I have already removed those lines in patchset 12. Let me know if you have any further concerns.
I see comments on PS11 saying things will be resolved and a new PS12 uploaded, but few changes.

Let me know if have answered your queries & if you have further inputs.
Based on that, I'll consolidate & pushed next patch.
Thanks!
